intro: Jehlia grandiflora, commonly known as the grandiflora jehlia, is a striking flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a subtle fragrance. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its blooming period occurs during the late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
